title: Security
values: Did you enable 2-step authentication?
Did you use email as a login option?
Did you prevent users from making multiple login attempts?
Did you use strong passwords with upper and lower case letters, numbers and special characters in all accounts?
Did you enable https in WordPress?
Did you set up a backup routine?
Installed monitoring scripts 24/7
Did you change the login URL?
Did you remove 'Search-Replace-DB-master' files from the server?
Did you use passwords with uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers and special characters on the database user?
Did you change the prefix of the tables in the database?
Have you made sure that your 'wp-config.php' file cannot be accessed by others?
Did you set folder permissions for 755 and files for 644?
Have you made sure that your 'wp-config.php' file cannot be accessed by others?
Did you generate new access keys in 'wp-config.php'?
Did you remove the 'license.txt', 'wp-config-sample.php' and 'readme.html' files?
Did you disable the editor through 'wp-config.php' with the code: define ('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);
Did you prevent the search of directories via .htaccess with the code: Options All -IndexesOptions All -Indexes
Avoid user registration

title: Administrative panel
values: Did you put the password in the wp-admin folder?
Is the WordPress version up to date?
Didn't use an account with username admin?
Did you create an 'editor' account to publish your content?
Have you installed a plugin to check if any files have been edited?
Did you create a backup routine?

title: Themes
values: Did you install only themes from trusted sources?
Did you remove the WordPress version in the theme?
Is the active theme updated to its latest version?
Did you delete inactive themes?
Did you insert the favicon?
Did you create the 404 page?
Did you remove all console.log and alerts from the javascripts used?
Does the theme support an image gallery with navigation option and lightbox?
Does the theme have the 'theme-color' meta tag?
Did you use the sprite technique to load multiple images?
Did you use the inputs correctly?
Is there a message modal configured if needed?
For all Custom Posts created, were all Singles.php created?
Was the author listing created? (author.php)
Was the tag listing created? (tags.php)
Does the site work or is any message shown if the user disables javascript?
Are color and contrast appropriated?
Did you create the display of search results?
Are all elements of the sidebar formatted correctly?

title: Comments
values: Is it possible to follow new comments by email in a post that the reader commented on?
Are the commenter's avatar working?
Are very long comment lists with pagination?
Are comment spam being effectively stopped?

title: Hosting and domain
values: Did you hire a reliable hosting?
Does the contracted hosting offer SSH access?
Does the hosting server handle an excessive amount of accesses if there is a peak in traffic?
Do you have access to DNS editing if necessary to change the server?
Did you enable error logs and check after publication if there are any errors on the server?

title: SEO
values: Did you set up Google Analytics?
Is the site registered with Google Search Console?
After publication, did you enable indexing?
Did you Install the SEO plugin?
Did you send the sitemap to search engines like Google, Bing and Yahoo?
Are robots.txt configured correctly?
Did you use 301 redirect to urls that were deleted or changed?
Did you add alt-tags to all images?
Did you fill in the SEO fields on all pages and posts? If not, did you at least guide the client?
Did you generate permanent links?
Did you block the indexing of custom posts as a slider to not display the single?
Do all pages have a single h1?
Do you have rich snippets?

title: Content
values: Is there a page created for “maintenance mode” in case the site needs to go down for maintenance reasons?
Was the cookie alert created?
Has the Privacy Policy page been published?
Did you exclude sample content like Lorem Ipsum and demo images?
Did you check that all text and image links are being loaded correctly on click?
Is your website accessible for users with disabilities? Does it meet WAI-ARIA standards?
If you made a new website and will upload the current one, was the old one backed up and removed from the server?
In the blog section, is it possible to display related content?
Are the social media links inserted correctly?
Are the entire family of social media icons available for viewing?
Did you test content in modern browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer and Firefox)
Is the customer training video available on the control panel for future reference if necessary?
The site has pagination and uses rel next and rel prev?
Have you revised the entire text to avoid spelling and concordance errors?
Did you add the site description and remove 'Just another WordPress site'?
Did you remove the 'staging' content and do the 301 redirect?
Do the sharing buttons like Twitter work properly?
In the blog section, is it possible to display the information of the content author and their social networks?
Can the author choose how to display the related content? Tags and / or categories?
Are all content edited by the panel? Did you forget any html as a phone number on the pages?
Are all formatting content such as lists, image alignment, tables correctly styled?
If there is no highlighted image, will a standard image be displayed in posts and pages?

title: Analytics
values: Have you created filters to exclude IP accesses from your workplace?
Did you activate the 'search parameter' on the website to identify future queries?
Did you insert a heat map script on the site?

title: Contact Form
values: Are the form messages being sent correctly?
Are the customers receiving emails correctly in the desired email?
Are all the message fields on the form translated correctly?
Are you storing message receipts for future export if requested by the customer?
Have you set up transactional email service?

title: Responsive
values: Have you tested the visualization content preview on all devices? (Mobile, Tablet and Computer)
Have you been reducing the size of the screen and seeing the size transition occur without any break in layout?
In the mobile version, smaller images are being loaded?
Did you use media queries to load icons, images and background in a smaller size in the mobile version?
Does the multilevel menu work perfectly in the mobile version?

title: Performance
values: Did you optimize all images?
Are the javascript files minified?
Are the css files minified?
Did you implement lazy load?
Did you configure server cache?
Did you do the speed analysis on sites like Google's PageSpeed and get a good score?
Is Gzip enabled?
Did you use preconnect?
Did you disable WordPress emoticons?
Did you use the InnoDB Storage Engine for MySQL?
Did you disable pingbacks?
After deleting a plugin, was the data in the database deleted?
Did you use the php flush function in the header?
Did you activate CDN?
Did you delete old revisions from the database?
Did you add ElasticSearch to the search?
